turn.1: What are some important archaeological sites in Mexico?
turn.2: Remains of these past civilizations can be found in archeological sites such as Pánuco, Castillo de Teayo, El Zapotal, Las Higueras, Quiahuiztlán, El Tajín, Cempoala, Tres Zapotes and San Lorenzo Tenochtitlán.
turn.4: The first major civilization in the territory of the current state is that of the Olmecs, a civilization with roots in the previous Archaic and Formative societies on the Gulf Coast and in the Isthmus of Tehuantepec.
turn.6: The Olmecs settled in the Coatzacoalcos River region and it became the center of Olmec culture.
turn.7: What other archaeological sites did the Olmecs build?
turn.8: The main ceremonial center here was San Lorenzo Tenochtitlán.
turn.9: Did the Olmecs build any other archaeological sites?
turn.10: Other major centers in the state include Tres Zapotes in the city of Veracruz and La Venta in Tabasco.
turn.11: What are some other interesting aspects about the Olmecs?
turn.12: The culture reached its height about 2600 years ago, with its best-known artistic expression being the colossal stone heads.
